comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Douglas AD-5 Skyraider in overall semi-gloss Sea Blue with white markings. MARINES on rear fuselage, code MP on tail and Modex 15 on engine cowling. The above picture may also be viewed here: 1000aircraftphotos.com/Contributions/VossJohn/7779.htm 1000aircraftphotos.com/Contributions/VossJohn/7779L.jpg "The aircraft is wearing the markings of USMC Marine Attack Squadron VMA-331, based at MCAS Miami, Florida. It eventually ended up with the South Vietnamese Air Force." [unfortunately serial number below horizontal stabilizer is indecipherable so further research is not possible] VMA-331 ‘Bumblebees’ flew AD-5 Skyraiders from 1954 to 1958 & AD-6 from 1959 until changeover to A4D Skyhawk. Codes used were MP and VL. skyraider.org/skyassn/skysqds.htm#anchor892644 a4skyhawk.org/4e/vma331/vma331.htm “I was in VMA 331 from Jul 57 until the spring of 62………. We flew AD-5's at Opa Locka until the summer of 59 and then deployed to West Pac for 14 months where we flew the AD-6. We were the last AD Squadron in the Marine Corps.”

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: The above aircraft is identified as Douglas AD-5 / A-1E Skyraider Bu No 133861 Seen here www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/4556321938/ Douglas AD-5 Skyraider Bu No 133861 c/n 9551 VMA-331- tail code MP, side number 15. In overall Sea Blue Gloss scheme. Photograph from USMC, taken February 21, 1956 Aircraft wearing markings of USMC Marine Attack Squadron VMA-331, based at MCAS Miami, Florida. Eventually ended up with South Vietnamese Air Force.

comment.author: 50482865@N03
comment._content: My favorite single engine attack plane, and in its multi seat config. Thanks.
